Articles.Content:
KSP Version: 0.90 OS X nosteam

screenshot: http://i.imgur.com/7KJcCWM.png

savefile: http://pastebin.com/7szKBSd6

logs: http://pastebin.com/qb1r69Xx

system profile: http://pastebin.com/sV6spNph

all stock, no mods at all

Basically don't know how to replicate it, so I'll just describe what I was doing:

First of all, downloaded the new 0.90, unzipped and started a new career mode in normal diff.

After taking Jeb off the launchpad with a MK1 pod + SRB + parachute, I land on water (duh!) and proceed to do some science. Recover craft.

Back at KSC, upgraded the first node in the science tree, got back, right-clicked on the VAB just to see what I'd get from upgrading, and then went into the VAB. Disco mode on.

Let me know if I can help with anything else!

Oh wow, yeah that looks fun, can you try toggling anti-aliasing to see if that helps, and there's a new button in Settings to toggle edge highlighting that may work.

Other than that, check all files are okay and restart.

That's a new symptom, but an old problem: KSP is running out of memory.

KSP(13457,0xb041f000) malloc: *** mach_vm_map(size=1048576) failed (error code=3)

*** error: can't allocate region

*** set a breakpoint in malloc_error_break to debug

[scenarioDestructibles]: Loading... 0 objects registered

It's possible you've actually managed to fill up all 16 GB, so closing other programs may help, but you may need to reduce the texture quality in the Graphics settings, or install Active Texture Management (after it's updated or confirmed compatible with 0.90).
